intro: Cynometra fortuna-tironis, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sterculiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish-brown bark and elliptical, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing flat, winged seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and timber, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
